skills.name: Solve one-step linear equations requiring addition or subtraction, with all positive integers
Solve one-step linear equations requiring multiplication or division, with all positive integers

explanations.C: The â˜… tells us how to go from 7ğ‘¥ to ğ‘¥. We know 7ğ‘¥ means 7 âœ• ğ‘¥ and that means ğ‘¥ is multiplied by 7. We therefore need to do the opposite and divide by 7. So 7ğ‘¥ Ã· 7 = ğ‘¥.

explanations.A: The â˜… tells us how to go from y/9 to y. We know y/9 means y divided by 9. Would adding 9 to y/9 leave just y?
explanations.B: The â˜… tells us how to go from y/9 to y. We know y/9 means y divided by 9. We therefore need to do the opposite and multiply by 9
explanations.C: The â˜… tells us how to go from y/9 to y. We know y/9 means y divided by 9. Would dividing y/9 by 9 again leave just y?
explanations.D: The â˜… tells us how to go from y/9 to y. We know y/9 means y divided by 9. Would subtracting 9 from y/9 leave just y?

explanations.A: The â˜… tells us how to go from ğ‘¥ - 7 to ğ‘¥. Here, 7 is being subtracted from ğ‘¥ so we need to do the opposite and add. So ğ‘¥ - 7 + 7 = ğ‘¥.
explanations.B: The â˜… tells us how to go from ğ‘¥ - 7 to ğ‘¥. What can we do to ğ‘¥ - 7 to end up with just ğ‘¥?
explanations.C: The â˜… tells us how to go from ğ‘¥ - 7 to ğ‘¥. What can we do to ğ‘¥ - 7 to end up with just ğ‘¥?
explanations.D: The â˜… tells us how to go from ğ‘¥ - 7 to ğ‘¥. What can we do to ğ‘¥ - 7 to end up with just ğ‘¥?

explanations.A: The â˜… tells us how to go from y + 9 to just y. What can we do to y + 9 to end up with just y?
explanations.B: The â˜… tells us how to go from y + 9 to just y. Would multiplying y + 9 by 9 leave us with y?
explanations.C: The â˜… tells us how to go from y + 9 to just y. Would dividing y + 9 by 9 leave us with y?
explanations.D: The â˜… tells us how to go from y + 9 to just y. We need to subtract the 9 to get y + 9 - 9 = y

explanations.A: The â˜… tells us how to go from 9y to just y. Would adding 9 to 9y leave us with y?
explanations.B: The â˜… tells us how to go from 9y to just y. Would multiplying 9 by 9y leave us with y?
explanations.C: The â˜… tells us how to go from 9y to just y. 9y means 9 x y, so when we divide by 9 we are left with just y
explanations.D: The â˜… tells us how to go from 9y to just y. Would subtracting 9 from 9y leave us with y?

explanations.A: The â˜… tells us how to go from ğ‘¥ + 7 to ğ‘¥. What can we do to ğ‘¥ + 7 to end up with just ğ‘¥?
explanations.B: The â˜… tells us how to go from ğ‘¥ + 7 to ğ‘¥. What can we do to ğ‘¥ + 7 to end up with just ğ‘¥?

explanations.A: The â˜… tells us how to go from y - 9 to just y. Adding 9 would give y - 9 + 9 which is just y
explanations.B: The â˜… tells us how to go from y - 9 to just y. Would multiplying y - 9 by 9 leave us with y?
explanations.C: The â˜… tells us how to go from y - 9 to just y. Would dividing y - 9 by 9 leave us with y?
explanations.D: The â˜… tells us how to go from y - 9 to just y. Would subtracting 9 from y - 9 leave us with y?

explanations.A: Not quite. Subtracting 3 will not solve the equation. Remember to 'undo' an operation we must do its inverse.
explanations.B: Not quite. Multiplying by 3 will not solve this equation. Remember to 'undo' an operation we must do its inverse, multiplication is not the inverse of subtraction.
explanations.C: Not quite. Dividing by 3 will not solve this equation. Remember to 'undo' an operation we must do its inverse, division is not the inverse of subtraction.
explanations.D: p = 15 is the correct answer. In this equation 3 is being subtracted from the unknown number p. To undo this subtraction we add 3 to both sides to get 15 = p which is the same as p = 15.

explanations.A: Not quite. Dividing by 5 will not solve this equation. Remember to 'undo' an operation we must do its inverse, division is not the inverse of subtraction.
explanations.B: p = 15 is the correct answer. In this equation 5 is being subtracted from the unknown number p. To undo this subtraction we add 5 to both sides to get 15 = p which is the same as p = 15.
explanations.C: Not quite. Subtracting 5 will not solve the equation. Remember to 'undo' an operation we must do its inverse.
explanations.D: Not quite. Multiplying by 5 will not solve this equation. Remember to 'undo' an operation we must do its inverse, multiplication is not the inverse of subtraction.
